screen.stepOne.inspectionCoincides.bulle: The collection and incubation of eggs and/or husbandry of wild-caught neonates delivered to the facility for incubation and/or rearing for
On-site egg production and hatching and/or live birth
screen.stepOne.facilityOwnerPresent: Confirm the facility owner/manager will be present at the facility for the inspection, and is aware of their requirement to provide records of stock and other documents. These may include copies of permits, breeding records, etc.

screen.stepTwo.informationRecorded.bulle: Inspect the facility and record information of
screen.stepTwo.recordsExaminedForStock: Examine facility records for stock. This may include, for example, husbandry, feeding or health records.

button.noOfSpecies: Number of specimens capable of being produced by the facility

screen.ProductionCapacityCalculator.info: Use this calculator to estimate the mean number of specimens capable of being produced by a facility based on the number of reproductive adult females observed and the average number of reproductive events per year.

Before an inspection, input information from previous inspections and official records on exports, etc. The calculator can also be used after an inspection, by inputting the number of specimens observed during the inspection.
screen.FeedbackTwo.question: How do you rate the app?
screen.FeedbackTwo.content: Share your ideas, comments, and suggestions with us. What do you like about the app? What can we do better?
screen.FeedbackOne.contentOne: We are always working to improve the guidance provided by CITIES so we would love to hear what is useful and working and how we can do better.
screen.FeedbackOne.contentTwo: This isn’t a way to contact us, though.
screen.FeedbackOne.contentThree: We cannot respond to feedback or bug reports individually. If you have a question or need help resolving a problem, you can contact the CITES Secretariat.
screen.FeedbackOne.contentFour: What would you like to do?
screen.FacilityScore.title: All forms completed. A number of points has been summed to determine the final facility score. Use this facility score to make a final determination about the facility.
screen.FacilityScoreGreaterEight.content: It is likely that the species in question is being ranched - apply source code R. In the case of operations claiming to breed the species in captivity, some doubt remains on the appropriateness of using source code C or D. Caution should be exercised when issuing permits. However, this score may simply reflect sub-optimal management, and additional data from more rigorous inspections are needed to determine production capacity with confidence.
screen.FacilityScoreLessEight.contentThr: It is unlikely that the facility is breeding or ranching the number of specimens claimed. Management Authorities should monitor the facilities’ operations closely. Further, more rigorous, inspections should be undertaken with the aid of additional (appropriate) expertise. Caution should be exercised when issuing permits for export. If additional inspections confirm illegal activity, the matter should be referred to enforcement officials for appropriate action.
screen.OnboardingOne.contentOne: CITES Management Authorities and others should conduct
screen.OnboardingOne.contentFive: of facilities and their operations that produce specimens for commercial trade
screen.OnboardingTwo.title: Inspections ensure that a facility is:
screen.OnboardingTwo.contentThree: Producing captive bred/ ranched specimens without regular augmentation of wild-caught specimen or acquisition of illegally obtained specimens
screen.OnboardingTwo.contentFour: Capable of producing specimens in numbers claimed as captive-bred or ranched
screen.OnboardingThree.contentOne: This app provides guidance for inspecting a facility and its operations.
screen.OnboardingThree.contentTwo: Information gathered during this process should be used to determine the veracity of a facility's claims of captive breeding and/or ranching
screen.OnboardingFour.contentThree: and ensure all tasks are completed before proceeding to the next step
screen.HomePage.header: WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO DO?

button.startedInspection: I have already started an inspection
screen.FacilityInfringement.title: What if the facility has infringement(s)?
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentOne: The nature of infringement(s) as well as legal and administrative actions resulting from those infringement(s) must be examined.
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentTwo: In most countries, an officer may suspend or revoke a licence, permit or special permit if they are satisfied that:
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentThree: (1) (a) the holder of the licence, permit or special permit has breached any conditions specified in the licence, permit or special permit;
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentFour: (b) the holder of the licence, permit or special permit has failed to comply with any provisions of this Act or any of its subsidiary legislation;
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentFive: (c) the holder of the licence, permit or special permit has been convicted of an offence under this Act or any of its subsidiary legislation; or
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentSix: (d) the granting of the licence, permit or special permit was induced by a false representation of fact by or on behalf of the holder of licence, permit or special permit.
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentSeven: (2) The licensing officer shall not suspend or revoke the licence, permit or special permit unless the licensing officer is satisfied, after giving the holder of the licence, permit or special permit an opportunity of making any representation in writing he may wish to make, that the licence, permit or special permit should be suspended or revoked.
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentEight: (3) Where a licence, permit or special permit is suspended or revoked, it shall have no effect during the period of suspension or from the date of revocation, as the case may be.
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentNine: (4) Where a licence, permit or special permit is revoked under subsection (1), the holder of the licence, permit or special permit shall immediately surrender the licence, permit or special permit to the licensing officer.
screen.FacilityInfringement.contentTen: (5) The decision of the licensing officer to suspend or revoke a licence, permit or special permit or not to suspend or revoke a licence, permit or special permit shall be communicated to the holder of the licence, permit or special permit by notice in writing as soon as practicable.
screen.FacilityRegistered.title: What if the facility is not legally registered to keep, breed or ranch the species in question?
screen.FacilityRegistered.contentOnePart: to begin the application process for legal registration.
screen.FacilityRegistered.contentTwo: In most countries, captive breeding and ranching operations for commercial purposes are typically registered with the government.
screen.FacilityRegistered.contentThreePa: species captive-bred for commercial purposes, check if the facility is registered on the:
screen.FormOne.title: FORM 1
screen.FormOne.contentOnePartOneThree: by using information from previous visits, if available.
screen.FormOne.contentOnePartTwo: If this information is not available, complete this form during your first inspection
screen.FormOne.contentTwo: Gather information to acquaint yourself with the facility before an inspection and provide a reference base for what a facility claims vs. what you will observe.

screen.OnboardingOneA.title: WHAT IS A SOURCE CODE?
screen.OnboardingOneA.contentOne: A letter used on CITES permits and certificates to indicate the source of a specimen. It is important that the correct source code is used to accurately describe the nature of the trade according to the CITES definitions.
screen.OnboardingTwoA.title: WHY ARE SOURCE CODES IMPORTANT?
screen.OnboardingTwoA.contentOne: Applying the correct source code can ensure that accurate analyses of trade data can be undertaken, for example, to identify the production systems used for wildlife, how these evolve over time, and understand the level of risk inherent in trade transactions.
screen.OnboardingThreeA.contentOne: Answer all the questions to arrive at the correct source code for the specimen.
screen.SourceCode.title: SOURCE CODE
screen.SourceCode.I.contentDescription: CITES-listed specimens that have been confiscated or seized. This source code must be used in conjunction with another source code.
screen.SourceCode.A.contentDescription: Plants that are artificially propagated in accordance with Resolution Conf. 11.11 (Rev. CoP17), as well as parts and derivatives thereof, exported under the provisions of Article VII, paragraph 5 (specimens of species included in Appendix I that have been propagated artificially for non-commercial purposes and specimens of species included in Appendices II and III).
screen.SourceCode.F.contentDescription: Animals born in captivity (F1 or subsequent generations) that do not fulfil the definition of ‘bred in captivity’ in Resolution Conf. 10.16 (Rev.), as well as parts and derivatives thereof.
screen.SourceCode.C.contentDescription: Animals bred in captivity in accordance with Resolution Conf. 10.16 (Rev.), as well as parts and derivatives thereof, exported under the provisions of Article VII, paragraph 5.
screen.SourceCode.O.contentDescription: Specimen acquired before the provisions of the Convention applied to it. If a certificate is issued by a Management Authority, then no other permit or certificate is required under the Convention to authorize export, import, or re-export.
screen.SourceCode.W.contentDescription: Specimens is taken from the wild.
screen.SourceCode.R.contentDescription: Specimens of animals reared in a controlled environment, taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild, where they would otherwise have had a very low probability of surviving to adulthood.
screen.SourceCode.U.contentDescription: Source of the specimen is unknown, but this must be justified.
screen.SourceCode.D.contentDescription: Appendix I animals bred in captivity for commercial purposes in operations included in the Secretariat’s Register, in accordance with Resolution Conf. 12.10 (Rev. CoP15), and Appendix-I plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes, as well as parts and derivatives thereof, exported under the provisions of Article VII, paragraph 4.
screen.SourceCode.D.letterDescription: CAPTIVE-BRED ANIMAL OR ARTIFICIALLY PROPAGATED PLANT
screen.SourceCode.X.contentDescription: Specimens is taken from a marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State.
screen.SourceCode.NotApplicable.contentD: The specimen is not CITES-listed and therefore does not require a CITES permit or associated source code.
screen.SourceCodeSelection.title: SOURCE CODE
screen.MoreInformation.title: MORE INFORMATION
screen.ExampleDialogueStep3.contentOne: Thank you for your co-operation today. We have completed the inspection.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep3.contentTwo: I will send you a copy of the inspection findings within the next two weeks to the e-mail address you provided. Is there another e-mail you would prefer me to send this information too?
screen.ExampleDialogueStep3.contentThree: Depending on these inspection findings, a follow-up inspection may be arranged. I will inform you if this is required when I send the inspection findings via e-mail.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep3.contentFour: Do you have any questions you would like to ask me before we finish today? Once again, thank you and your staff for your time and assistance with the inspection. It is much appreciated.
screen.StepSummary.contentTwo: You have completed the inspection and all associated forms.
screen.StepSummary.contentThree: What would you like to do?
screen.q4MoreInfo.title: SUFFICIENT INFORMATION TO DETERMINE IF THE SPECIMEN WAS LEGALLY ACQUIRED MAY INCLUDE
screen.q4MoreInfo.contentOne: Statements or affidavits made under oath and carrying a penalty of perjury
screen.q4MoreInfo.contentFive: Hunting permits or tags, or other documentary evidence
screen.q9MoreInfo.contentTwo: An environment that is manipulated for the purpose of producing a particular species, that has boundaries designed to prevent animals, eggs or gametes of the species from entering or leaving it. General characteristics of a controlled environment for an animal may include:
screen.q9MoreInfo.contentThree: Boundaries designed to prevent animals, eggs or gametes of the species from entering or leaving it
screen.q9MoreInfo.contentTen: A non-natural environment that is intensively manipulated by human intervention for the purpose of plant production. General characteristics of controlled conditions for a plant may include but are not limited to:
screen.q9MoreInfo.contentFifteen: Nursery Operations, such as potting, bedding or protection.
screen.q1MoreInfo.title: IF YOU ARE UNSURE WHAT APPENDIX THE SPECIMEN IS LISTED IN:
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentThree: I am an officer with the Management Authority.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentSeven: and will be accompanying me today on this inspection.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentEight: As arranged, I am meeting with you today to conduct an inspection of your
operation. The inspection should take approximately 2 hours to complete.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentNine: In addition, I will ask you several questions relating to this operation and as arranged, I will also inspect any records you keep on the operation, such as stock reports, breeding records, pedigrees, veterinarian bills and reports, etc.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentTen: During this inspection I will be recording information using this device, in my notebook and taking photos.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentTwelv: I will ask you to please read and sign this consent form that details your acknowledgement of this.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentThirt: As required by law, please keep a copy of the official administrative inspection warrant for your records.
screen.ExampleDialogueStep2.contentFourt: This will involve a physical inspection of the facilities and boundary fences, if present, as well as an examination of your stock and stick records.
screen.ExampleDialogueConsentFormStep2.c: , agree that I have understood the following information and agree that :
(1) I, as the owner, operator, or agent in charge of the premises, have been informed of my right not to have an inspection made without an inspection warrant;
(2) have the right to refuse to consent to such an inspection;
(3) anything of an incriminating nature which may be found may be seized and used against me in a criminal prosecution;
(4) have been presented with a notice of
(5) acknowledge that my consent has been given voluntarily and without threats of any kind;
(6) can withdraw my consent at any time during the inspection; and
(c) will be provided with a copy of my written consent.
screen.NoExport.header: PLEASE CONTACT THE CITES SECRETARIAT FOR MORE INFORMATION
screen.FormTwo.title: FORM 2
screen.FormTwo.contentOne: Complete this form during an inspection by using your observations and information gathered during the inspection.
screen.FormTwo.contentTwo: Use this form to collect background information on the facility to compare with previous and future inspections.
form.label.employmentHours: How many staff are currently employed at the facility?
form.label.professionalVeterinaryService: Does the operation have access to professional veterinary services?
form.label.vetNameAndAddress: Please provide the name and address of the Veterinarian
form.label.animalKeptAtOtherLocation: Are animals keep at any other location(s)?
form.label.addressOfOtherAnimalsPartOne: If yes, what is the address of the location(s)?
form.label.addressOfOtherAnimalsPartTwo: Set a reminder to inspect these location(s).
form.label.specimenBottom: If this is your first inspection, please enter 0.
screen.FormThree.title: FORM 3
screen.FormThree.contentThree: Use this form to collect detailed information on
screen.FormThree.contentFive: being bred or ranched at the facility.
form.label.sourceCodeInitialStock: CITES Source code for initial stock
form.label.numberOfMalesInitialStock: Number of males of initial stock
form.label.numberOfFemalesInitialStock: Number of females of initial stock
form.label.additionalAnimalsAcquiredSinc: Have additional animals been obtained since you acquired the initial stock?
form.label.addressOfAdditionalStock: If yes, where was this stock obtained from?
form.label.whenDidYouBreedThisSpecies: When did you start breeding this species?
form.label.numberProducedInPreviousYear: Number produced in the previous year
form.label.numberHarvestedInPreviousYear: Number harvested in the previous year
form.label.percentageOfFemalesBreedEachY: Percentage of females that breed each year (%)
form.label.sizeOrMassAtSexualMaturity: Size or mass at sexual maturity (cm or g)
form.label.sizeOrMassAtSaleOrExport: Approximate size at sale or export (cm or g)
form.label.percentageOfJuvenilesSurviveB: Percentage of juveniles to survive beyond 2 weeks, including mortalities of eggs that did not hatch.

questionContent.questionOne: Is the species listed in the CITES Appendices (I, II or III)?
questionContent.questionTwo: Was the specimen acquired before the provisions of the Convention applied to it?
questionContent.questionThreePartOne: Was the animal confiscated or seized?
questionContent.questionFour: Is there sufficient information about the specimen to determine its source?
questionContent.questionFive: Was the specimen taken from the marine environment and not under the jurisdiction of any State?
questionContent.questionSeven: Was the specimen taken from the wild?
questionContent.questionEight: Was the specimen taken from the wild as an egg or juvenile that had a very low probability of surviving to adulthood?
questionContent.questionNinePartOne: Was the specimen reared in a
questionContent.questionTenPartOne: Has the specimen been transferred to Appendix II and marked in accordance with
questionContent.questionEleven: Is the species listed in the CITES Appendices (II or III)?
questionContent.questionTwelvePartOne: Does the specimen fulfil the requirements under
questionContent.questionThirteenPartOne: Was the specimen derived from parents that mated or otherwise transferred gametes in a
questionContent.questionThirteenPartSix: when development of the offspring began (asexual reproduction)?
questionContent.questionFourteen: Was the specimen born in captivity, in a controlled environment?
questionContent.questionFifteenPartOne: Was the breeding stock established in accordance with the provisions of CITES and relevant national laws?
questionContent.questionFifteenPartThree: in a manner not detrimental to the survival of the species in the wild
questionContent.questionSixteenPartOne: Is the breeding stock maintained without the introduction of specimens from the wild, except for the occasional addition of animals, eggs or gametes, in accordance with the provisions of CITES and relevant national laws?
questionContent.questionSixteenPartThree: In a manner not detrimental to the survival of the species in the wild?
questionContent.questionSeventeenPartOne: Has the breeding stock produced offspring of second generation (F2) or subsequent generations (F3, F4, etc.) in a
questionContent.questionSeventeenPartFou: Is managed in a manner that has been demonstrated to be capable of reliably producing second-generation offspring in a
questionContent.questionEighteen: In which CITES Appendix is the specimen listed?
questionContent.questionNineteen: Has the specimen been bred for commercial purposes?
questionContent.questionTwenty: Was the specimen bred at a CITES-registered breeding operation?
questionContent.questionTwentyTwoPartOne: Was the specimen grown from seeds, cuttings, divisions, callus tissues or other plant tissues, spores or other propagules that were derived from cultivated parental stock in accordance with paragraph 1b) of
questionContent.questionTwentyThreePartO: Was the specimen grown from wild collected seeds or spores in accordance with exemptions in
questionContent.questionTwentyFour: Was the specimen grown from a cutting or division?
questionContent.questionTwentyFive: Was the cutting or division taken from a wild plant that is NOT considered cultivated parental stock?
questionContent.questionTwentySix: In which CITES Appendix is the species listed?
questionContent.questionTwentySeven: Has the specimen been grown for commercial purposes?
questionContent.questionTwentyEight: Has the specimen been artificially propagated at a CITES-registered nursery?
